defaultSeo.metaTitle: The photographical musings of Nikita Kozlov
defaultSeo.metaDescription:
What if the truth didnâ€™t hurtâ€”after all, the truth is all there is, and yet the world remains a beautiful place if you choose to see it that way, silky in its refinement yet truthful enough to be uncomfortable.

Silky light drapes the world in delicate, exotic threads, luxurious to the eye yet secretly strong, so smooth and lustrous that even the hard edges of truth begin to soften. In that glimmer, the genuine and authentic emerge. An irreplaceable shimmer that feels soothing on the surface yet substantive at its core, ultimately liberating us to see beauty without closing our eyes.
